subject: Investing
title: Hindsight Bias: I Knew It All Along
description: A quick, practical guide to Hindsight Bias: I Knew It All Along.

hook.text: After the 2008 crash, everyone claimed they 'saw it coming.' Almost nobody actually acted on it.

buildup.text: Hindsight bias rewrites your memory so past events seem predictable after they've happened.

discovery.text: This creates overconfidence: if you think you predicted the last crash, you'll believe you can predict the next.

twist.text: Studies show people misremember their own forecasts. They recall being right far more often than they were.

climax.text: Keeping a written investment journal with dated predictions exposes hindsight bias in real time.

punchline.text: If you didn't write it down before it happened, you didn't 'know it all along.'

quiz.question: What is hindsight bias?
options: Believing past events were predictable after they occurred
